1.title: Golf
1.author: by Jim Unger
1.appears_in: reproduced on p. 158 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The surgeon is in the operating room with a golf bag on his back.

2.title: Golf
2.author: Ralph Dunagin
2.series: June 5, 1980) "Someone Smuggled a Hacksaw In With His Golf Clubs"*
2.appears_in: reproduced on p. 124 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Officials at a minimum security prison are talking.

3.title: Golf
3.author: G
3.series: July 11, 1980) "I Just Hope I Don't Embarrass Sonny"*
3.appears_in: B. Trudeau. reproduced on p. 128 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Zonker selects his tan for the Gerald R. Ford Summer Biathlon (a golf suntan tournament): Sonny Bono's "Freeway Bold."

4.title: Golf
4.author: Hart
4.series: Aug. 12, 1980) "You're the Only One Left to Play With"*
4.appears_in: reproduced on p. 131 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Golfers talk before they tee off; one asks about making it a little more interesting.

5.title: Golf
5.author: by Parker & Hart
5.series: Aug. 27, 1980) "A Siding Salesman, a Lawyer, a Politician and a Thief"*
5.appears_in: reproduced on p. 133 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: A foursome is described, and the question comes up of which one is the thief.

6.title: Golf
6.author: Schulz.
6.series: June 16, 1981) "I Need That Golf Ball More Than You Do"*
notes: Summary: Patty says she's going to be a famous golfer, and takes the ball from Lucy.

7.title: Golf
7.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Peppermint Patty practices sand shots in the sandbox.

8.title: Golf
8.author: MacNelly
8.series: Aug. 29, 1981) "They Meant to Say It's a Game of Hours"*
8.appears_in: reproduced on p. 121 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Bumpkins is caddying for the Professor, who remarks that golf is a game of inches.

9.title: Golf
9.author: by Jim Unger
9.series: 1982) "I Was Wondering How You'd Play That Shot"
9.appears_in: reproduced on p. 162 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The golf ball is shooting up out of the green.

10.title: Golf
10.author: Harold LeDoux.
10.series: May 27, 1982) "Didn't We Have a Golf Game at the Country Club Once?"*

11.title: Golf
11.author: Lichty & Wagner
11.series: June 3, 1982) "Here's the Worst of It: Some of the Golf Carts at the Club are Becoming Obsolete"
11.appears_in: reproduced on p. 151 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: In a room with flip charts of jets, tanks and missiles, the generals discuss military equipment.

12.title: Golf
12.author: Art Sansom.
12.series: June 30, 1982) "You're Quitting? We've Only Played 12 Holes!"*
notes: Summary: Brutus quits after 74 strokes.

13.title: Golf
13.author: by Schulz.
13.series: Aug. 11, 1982) "I Have to Bounce a Golf Ball Against the Steps"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown doesn't have a place to play baseball.

14.title: Golf
14.author: Thaves
14.series: Aug. 13, 1982) "I Think I Interrupted One Of Their Religious Ceremonies"*
14.appears_in: reproduced on p. 122 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Irate golfers are chasing an alien back to his flying saucer.

15.title: Golf
15.author: Art Sansom.
15.series: Sept. 1, 1982) "I Need a Starting Time for Tomorrow, Harry"*
notes: Summary: Brutus says golf is crummy, miserable and frustrating, and hates tees, roughs, fairways, and greens.

16.title: Golf
16.author: Hart.
notes: Summary: The hole turns into a Pacman and gobbles a putt.

17.title: Golf
17.author: by Auth & Szep
17.appears_in: reproduced on p. 134 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: One golfer is watching another one putt, and we see the thought balloon of the watcher.

18.title: Golf
18.author: Guy & Brad Gilchrist.
18.series: Sept. 18, 1982) "Meet Floyd Watson, Buford Nicklaus, and Ducky Palmer"*
notes: Summary: On the golf course, Kermit is impressed to hear that Fozzie knows golfers Watson, Nicklaus and Palmer.

19.title: Golf
19.author: Hart.
19.series: Sept. 28, 1982) "Reason Captain Hit Ball Out of Bounds"*
notes: (Wiley's Dictionary)
Summary: The definition of "Captain Hook."

20.title: Golf
20.author: [No author]
20.series: Oct. 1, 1982) "This Should Be an Easy Putt"*
notes: Summary: Giants are using Bugs' rabbit hole for golf.

21.title: Golf
21.author: Gordon Bess.
21.series: Oct. 22, 1982) "It's the Golf Lessons that Kill You"*
notes: Summary: The medicine man complains about the cost of becoming a doctor.

22.title: Golf
22.author: by Brant Parker and Johnny Hart
22.series: May 8, 1983) "How Much Are We Playing For?"*
22.appears_in: reproduced on p. 152 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The king sniffs the ball washer, and recommends lifting your head as soon as possible.

23.title: Golf
23.author: Bob Thaves
23.series: July 2, 1983) "I Wish They'd Replace their Darn Divots!"*
23.appears_in: reproduced on p. 155 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Two planets are talking about golfers.

24.title: Golf
24.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: To check the wind, Snoopy throws some loose grass in the air before he takes his golf shot, and the grass all lands on Woodstock.

25.title: Golf
25.author: Thaves.
notes: Summary: Another golfer asks Frank what his handicap is.

26.title: Golf
26.author: by Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown compliments Snoopy on his putt, and Snoopy explains.

27.title: Golf
27.author: by Johnny Hart
27.appears_in: reproduced on p. 144 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: B.C. announces the "B.C. Open," commenting on colored balls, weird clothing, etc.

28.title: Golf
28.author: Bittle.
28.series: Aug. 29, 1983) "Well, My Flat Feet Kept Me Out of the Army"*
notes: Summary: Artie is looking for somebody to play golf with; Geech says he plays, so Artie asks him what is handicap is.

29.title: Golf
29.author: Hart.
29.series: Sept. 2, 1983) "Could You Just Hold It In Your Hand, For Once?"*
notes: Summary: Grog has the pin for the 9th hole in his teeth.

30.title: Golf
30.author: [No author]
30.series: Nov. 16, 1983) "I Think he Weally Enjoys Slicing"*
notes: Summary: A golf ball lands in Elmer's carrot patch, and Bugs takes the opportunity to obtain a few carrots.

31.title: Golf
31.author: by Mort Walker
31.series: Dec. 29, 1983) "I Thought Ronald McDonald Might Have Taken Up Golf"*
31.appears_in: reproduced on p. 169 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Mrs. Halftrack makes a comment about Amos's golf outfit.

32.title: Golf
32.author: MacNelly
32.series: 1984) "A Caddy Might Be Able to Find the Ball, but a Golf Cart Will Never Laugh At You"*
32.appears_in: reproduced on p. 120 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).

33.title: Golf
33.author: Bill Hoest
33.series: Apr. 25, 1984) "It's Nothing Against You, Loretta. I'd Prefer Golf to Any Woman!"
33.appears_in: Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).

34.title: Golf
34.author: Jim Davis
34.series: May 2, 1984) "I'd Straighten that Left Arm a Bit, and Turn that Right Hand Over More"*
34.appears_in: reproduced on p. 137 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Jon has knocked out an old lady with his golf shot, and asks Garfield for advice.

35.title: Golf
35.author: [No author]
35.series: May 11, 1984) "No, You Got a Duck and I'm Going to Sue You for it"*
notes: Summary: Yosemite Sam is golfing and thinks he got a birdie; Daffy Duck is unhappy.

36.title: Golf
36.author: Ketcham.
36.series: May 16, 1984) "The Way You're Actin' You'd Think It Was a Bowling Ball"*
notes: Summary: Dennis has landed a golf ball in the wok.

37.title: Golf
37.author: Art Sansom
37.series: June 4, 1984) "I'm Not Just Saying That Because You're My Boss"*
37.appears_in: reproduced on p. 133 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Brutus tells Veeblefester he has great potential for scratch golf; Veeblefester's tee is surrounded by divot holes.

38.title: Golf
38.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi was on his way to play golf, but we see him digging a hole for Lois to plant a tree.

39.title: Golf
39.author: Gordon Bess.
notes: Summary: Pokey's parents predict his future occupation when they see him practicing golf.

41.title: Golf
41.author: by Tom Wilson.
41.series: July 16, 1984) "If You Play Golf, Stop! If You Don't, Start!"
notes: Summary: Ziggy's doctor recommends.

42.title: Golf
42.author: [No author]
42.series: July 25, 1984) "The Only Way to Get Two Birdies with One Stroke"*
notes: Summary: Yosemite Sam likes to golf with his axe, and slices the ball.

43.title: Golf
43.author: Schulz
43.appears_in: reproduced on p. 137 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Snoopy plays in any charity tournament for a disease he might get.

44.title: Golf
44.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Sitting in a shopping cart, Snoopy learns the tournament rules.

45.title: Golf
45.author: Schulz.
45.series: Aug. 10, 1984) "Tournament Golf Can Be Very Nerve-Wracking"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy's shaking all over, and hasn't made it to the first tee.

46.title: Golf
46.author: Mort Walker.
46.series: Aug. 24, 1984) "How Was It Caddying for Sarge?"*
notes: Summary: Sarge got angry and bent his whole bag of clubs over his knee.

47.title: Golf
47.author: K McC.
47.series: Aug. 27, 1984) "I Got Us Jobs as Caddies"*
notes: Summary: Tommy's golfer puts him in harness and treats him like a mule.

48.title: Golf
48.author: K McC.
notes: Summary: Tommy's golfer calls him 'Mule' and asks him what club he should use.

49.title: Golf
49.author: by Johnny Hart.
notes: Summary: The caddy hands him the number "7" fashioned in iron pipe.

50.title: Golf
50.author: K McC.
notes: Summary: Tommy drops the golf clubs and makes a run for it, and the golfer hits him on the head with a golf ball and stuns him.

51.title: Golf
51.author: K McC.
51.series: Aug. 30, 1984) "A Good Caddy Never Cries in his Feed Bag"*
notes: Summary: Tommy was planning to escape at the end of nine holes, but the golfer chains him to a post.

52.title: Golf
52.author: Hart
52.appears_in: reproduced on p. 131 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The caddy reads the green, saying, 'The blades are lovely, green and slick, Just perfect for your putting stick'.

53.title: Golf
53.author: K McC.
53.series: Aug. 31, 1984) "Will Someone Please Call the Humane Society?"*
notes: Summary: The golfer figures out the bill for 18 holes of caddying; Tommy owes three dollars.

54.title: Golf
54.author: by Bob Thaves
54.series: Sept. 22, 1984) "I Scored a Hole-In-One at the Liars' Club Golf Tournament"*
54.appears_in: reproduced on p. 168 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).

55.title: Golf
55.author: by Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: The general hits his golf ball in the office, and smashes the computer.

56.title: Golf
56.author: by Mort Walker
56.series: Feb. 26, 1985) "The World is Full of Wimps"*
56.appears_in: reproduced on p. 172 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: General Halftrack is trying to find someone to play golf with in a blizzard.

57.title: Golf
57.author: G
57.series: Apr. 9, 1985) "First Day In, I'm Sent to Grenada"*
notes: Summary: The Vietnam vets are still bitter about how they were treated when they got home, but Willie got a parade after invading a golf course on Grenada.

58.title: Golf
58.author: Schulz.
58.series: May 27, 1985) "In the Game of Life, Grampa has a String of Double Bogeys"*
notes: Summary: Grampa got in trouble at the golf course. His handicap is fifteen, so he parked at the sign that said "handicap parking."

59.title: Golf
59.author: Dean Young.
59.series: July 6, 1985) "I Guess Last Time You Were Here"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood's struggling in a sand trap, and asks Herb and the caddie when they've seen him play so badly.

60.title: Golf
60.author: [No author]
60.series: Aug. 22, 1985) "Thank Heavens This is 1,000,000 B.C. and the Atomic Bomb Hasn't Been Invented Yet!"*
notes: Summary: Fred is arguing about his score, and Dino the caddy comments.

61.title: Golf
61.author: Dik Browne
61.series: Feb. 12, 1986) "You Told the Men We Were Invading Scotland, Didn't You?"*
61.appears_in: reproduced on p. 151 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The viking warrior crewmen all have golf bags as well as weapons.

62.title: Golf
62.author: by Bob Thaves.
62.series: Feb. 14, 1986) "That's Really Putting the Heart Before the Course"*
notes: Summary: Frank calls from the clubhouse, to find the others have gone to a Valentine's party instead.

63.title: Golf
63.author: Gordon Bess.
63.series: Feb. 15, 1986) "I've Just Got to Get a Faster Golf Cart!"*
notes: Summary: The medicine man has decided that golf is causing him to neglect his medical practice.

64.title: Golf
64.author: by Jim Davis.
64.series: Mar. 4, 1986) "I've Never Been so Ashamed in My Life"*
notes: Summary: When he sees how Jon is dressed, Garfield thinks they may be going to clown college. When he finds out they're going to play golf, Garfield appears with a bag over his head.

65.title: Golf
65.author: by Jim Davis.
65.series: Mar. 5, 1986) "You Stupid Ball! I'll Show You!"*
notes: Summary: Jon swings and misses the golf ball, and Garfield stomps it.

66.title: Golf
66.author: by Jim Davis.
66.series: Mar. 6, 1986) "I Think You Swing Too Hard"*
notes: Summary: Jon swings his golf club so hard he spins around.

67.title: Golf
67.author: Saunders and Ziegler, Armstrong
67.appears_in: reproduced on p. 148 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Jan Lucas finds the apartment if well furnished, including something for her husband.

68.title: Golf
68.author: Saunders and Ziegler, Armstrong
68.series: Mar. 24, 1986) "I Was Afraid Jan Would Insist That I Spend the Rest of My Life Walking Around Some Stupid Cow Pasture"*
68.appears_in: reproduced on p. 148 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Calvin Lucas is relieved to hear that the previous tenant will probably be back for the golf clubs.

69.title: Golf
69.author: Saunders and Ziegler, Armstrong
69.series: Apr. 10, 1986) "For the First Time In My Life I Won't Be Embarrassed to Have a Caddy!"*
69.appears_in: reproduced on p. 148 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Calvin will carry her golf clubs to the car.

70.title: Golf
70.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Julius Dithers has only played golf once, and he broke 80.

71.title: Golf
71.author: Jerry Scott.
71.series: Apr. 16, 1986) "OK, My Brussels Sprouts are Gone. Now May I Be Excused?"*
notes: Summary: Nancy has set the sprouts on tees and hit them with a golf club.

72.title: Golf
72.author: by Ted Key.
notes: Summary: Hazel switches the implements in the golf bag as a hint.
Wordless panel.

73.title: Golf
73.author: Young & Drake.
73.series: Apr. 26, 1986) "Cheer Up, Dad. This Year Has to be Better"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood's last score card from last year falls out of his golf bag as he gets ready for the new season.

74.title: Golf
74.author: by Bill Watterson.
notes: Summary: Calvin is hitting golf balls into a big pit.

75.title: Golf
75.author: [No author]
75.series: May 21, 1986) "He Got His Tail Beat in a Golf Match This Morning"*
notes: Summary: The receptionist warns Fred that the doctor might be a little rough.

76.title: Golf
76.author: by Tom Wilson
76.appears_in: reproduced on p. 140 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Ziggy sinks the putt for a personal best score, then discovers he's put the ball in a rabbit hole.

77.title: Golf
77.author: Bittle.
77.series: June 24, 1986) "I've Never Lost One Putting Before!"*
notes: Summary: Artie's upset because he's lost a golf ball.

78.title: Golf
78.author: Dik Browne.
78.series: July 2, 1986) "Why is This Club Called a Mashie Niblick?"*

79.title: Golf
79.author: Dik Browne.
79.series: July 7, 1986) "Some of These Golf Outfits Would Look Great On Me!"*
notes: Summary: Lois shows an uncharacteristic interest in golf lessons.

80.title: Golf
80.author: by Bob Thaves.
80.series: July 14, 1986) "No, You Can Also Watch It On TV"*
notes: Summary: Frank thinks golf isn't all there is to life.

81.title: Golf
81.author: Rechin-Wilder.
81.series: July 16, 1986) "If You Wanted to Play Golf Today Why Didn't You Say So, Ernie?"
notes: Summary: Ernie is using a golf club for a fishing pole.

82.title: Golf
82.author: [No author]
82.series: July 21, 1986) "I've Told You a Thousand Times Not to Leave Them Lying in the Middle of the Living Room"*
notes: Summary: Wilma has backed the car over Fred's new golf clubs.

83.title: Golf
83.author: Hart.
83.series: July 23, 1986) "The Manager Agreed to Open the Bar at 7 AM Instead of Noon"*
notes: Summary: Fighting at the golf course over starting times has been settled.

84.title: Golf
84.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Cosmo has a swamp glider on the course.

85.title: Golf
85.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Fred's home early, and asks Wilma she'd play with someone who cheats at golf.

86.title: Golf
86.author: MacNelly.
86.series: July 26, 1986) "The Key to Golf is Knowing Which Club to Throw"
notes: Summary: Shoe whiffs a shot.

87.title: Golf
87.author: by Jim Davis.
87.series: Aug. 4, 1986) "Next Time Warn Me Before You Get Ready to Play Golf"*
notes: Summary: Jon startles Garfield by appearing suddenly in his golf clothes.

88.title: Golf
88.author: by Jeff MacNelly.
88.series: Aug. 4, 1986) "Planning a Short Day, I See"*
notes: Summary: Shoe can tell that the Professor is planning to sneak out for golf, because the clubs don't quite fit in the briefcase.

89.title: Golf
89.author: by Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Odie dresses like Jon in a polka-dotted shirt and a checked cap.

90.title: Golf
90.author: by Jim Davis.
90.series: Aug. 8, 1986) "Here Comes the Grounds Keeper, and, Yes, I Believe He's Carrying a Gun"*
notes: Summary: Jon tells his caddy, Odie, to fetch the ball, and Odie digs a big hole in the course.

91.title: Golf
91.author: Jim Davis.
91.series: Aug. 9, 1986) "I Decided to Lighten the Load"*
notes: Summary: Garfield the caddy brings Jon an empty golf bag.

92.title: Golf
92.author: by Johnny Hart.
92.series: Sept. 3, 1986) "A Golfer Shoots and Wins but a Hunter Shoots and Loses"*
notes: (Wiley's Dictionary)
Definition of "Eagle."

93.title: Golf
93.author: by Jeff MacNelly.
93.series: Sept. 9, 1986) "Golf Would Be a Whole Lot More Enjoyable if you had Teammates to Blame the Bad Shots On"
notes: Summary: Skyler is talking, and Cosmo's ball is up in a tree.

94.title: Golf
94.author: by Jeff MacNelly.
94.series: Sept. 10, 1986) "The Early Bird Gets the Good Tee-Off Time"*
notes: Summary: There's more to it than worms.

95.title: Golf
95.author: MacNelly.
95.series: Sept. 23, 1986) "Golf Keeps Me on a Even Keel"*
notes: Summary: Cosmo goes golfing when he's in a really good mood, and it evens out.

96.title: Golf
96.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Shoe observes a dogleg to the left, but the fairway looks straight to the Professor.

97.title: Golf
97.author: [No author]
97.series: Oct. 21, 1986) "You Can Still Make Church If You Leave Now"*
notes: Summary: Brutus misses a putt three times, and a little angel at his shoulder has a suggestion.

98.title: Golf
98.author: by Charles Schulz.
98.series: Oct. 27, 1986) "I Have an Educated Slice, but it Only Went to the Third Grade"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy isn't happy with his golf stroke.

99.title: Golf
99.author: [No author]
99.series: Nov. 15, 1986) "They Just Don't Like to Lie about Scores"*
notes: Summary: Fred and Barney wonder why their wives don't want to play golf, and Pebbles knows why.

100.title: Golf
100.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Appearances are deceiving, because really he's hunting gophers with a golf club.

101.title: Golf
101.author: Mort Walker.
101.series: Dec. 26, 1986) "I Think It Only Works in Sports"*
notes: Summary: The General thinks Arnold Palmer's comeback is great, then looks at Miss Buxley.

102.title: Golf
102.author: Dik Browne.
102.series: Jan. 31, 1987) "My Ball Just Cracked in Half"*
notes: Summary: Maybe it's too cold for golf.

103.title: Golf
103.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Halftrack's career, marriage and golf game are going badly and he's depressed.

104.title: Golf
104.author: Frank Johnson.
notes: Summary: Boner is giving the aardvark golf tips.

105.title: Golf
105.author: Dik Browne.
105.series: Feb. 21, 1987) "That's Ridiculous! How Can You Put a Curse on a Day?"*
notes: Summary: Irma is furious about Thirsty playing golf, and it starts to snow on the course.

106.title: Golf
106.author: by Schulz.
106.series: Mar. 11, 1987) "The Golf Pro Says for you to Stop Marching Through All the Sand Traps"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown has to relay a complaint to Snoopy in his foreign legion outfit.

107.title: Golf
107.author: Dik Browne.
107.series: Mar. 14, 1987) "They Say Your Weight Should Be Evenly Distributed"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty goes to the refrigerator to improve his golf swing.

108.title: Golf
108.author: Art Sansom
108.series: Mar. 28, 1987) "We Missed You in Church This Morning, Bro. Thornapple!"*
108.appears_in: reproduced on p. 123 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: A man with a bag over his head is carrying golf clubs; the preacher is not fooled.

109.title: Golf
109.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: At the 19th hole, Lord Plushbottom proposes a toast to Scotland, and the inventors of golf and scotch.

110.title: Golf
110.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: Lord P. transfers his skill at the golf course to hoeing the garden.

111.title: Golf
111.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: Plushie has trouble keeping his eye on the ball after the 3rd ricochet.

112.title: Golf
112.author: Hart.
112.series: July 24, 1987) "I've Got to Correct That Slice"*
notes: Summary: The anteater misses the ant and cuts the top off the anthill.

113.title: Golf
113.author: Dik Browne.
113.series: Aug. 29, 1987) "I Just Lined Up a Golf Game"*
notes: Summary: Chip has fixed the lawnmower, but now Hi has other plans and Chip is stuck doing the yard.

114.title: Golf
114.author: Frank Johnson.
114.series: Sept. 2, 1987) "This Hole is a Lot Tougher Since they Added a Sand Trap!"*
notes: Summary: Captain Boner is golfing, and there's a pile of sand on the deck.

115.title: Golf
115.author: [No author]
115.series: Sept. 5, 1987) "I Wanted Her To See What Our Lawn Could Look Like If She Really Worked At It!"*
notes: Summary: Irma Thurston is joining Hi and Thirsty on the golf course today.

116.title: Golf
116.author: by Ralph Dunagin and Dana Summers
116.series: Oct. 4, 1987) "And Two Squirrels and a Bunny!"*
116.appears_in: reproduced on p. 156 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Wilson reports that Morris Middleton got a birdie at golf.

117.title: Golf
117.author: Mort Walker.
117.series: Oct. 30, 1987) "Your Drive Almost Hit the Couple Ahead of Us, Sir"*

118.title: Golf
118.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: Plushbottom hits his golf ball straight, and the caddy suggests he must have put some slice on his hook.

119.title: Golf
119.author: Mort Walker.
119.series: Nov. 25, 1987) "Something Important Must Have Come Up"*
notes: Summary: General Halftrack doesn't call his officers for golf, because Miss Buxley is playing with him.

120.title: Golf
120.author: Mort Walker.
120.series: Dec. 19, 1987) "Why Do You Use Such an Expensive Club, Sir?"*
notes: Summary: The General thinks twice before wrapping his graphite driver around a tree.

121.title: Golf
121.author: Armstrong.
121.series: Apr. 7, 1988) "I Hate That Dogleg on the 8th Fairway"*
notes: Summary: Bitsy is hit by Marvin's golf ball and startled awake.

122.title: Golf
122.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: The doctor asks Lord Plushbottom not to play golf on Tuesdays, as he finds too many divots on Wednesday mornings.

123.title: Golf
123.author: by Mort Walker & Dik Browne.
123.series: July 9, 1988) "You Might Like This Program That Analyzes Your Golf Scores"*
notes: Summary: Hi buys a computer because the salesman finds just the right pitch.

124.title: Golf
124.author: Graham.
124.series: July 11, 1988) "Enter a Businessman, Exit a Golfer!"*
notes: Summary: Fred's master plays golf after work.

125.title: Golf
125.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: Plushbottom sees the golf carts as too expensive to rent, so he takes Kayo's bike.

126.title: Golf
126.author: by Jeff MacNelly.
notes: (Golf Tips from the Perfesser)

127.title: Golf
127.author: Bittle.
127.series: Aug. 6, 1988) "They Can Increase the Depth of Your Divots by about 20% or 30%"*
notes: Summary: The salesman explains why the space-age clubs are so much more expensive.

128.title: Golf
128.author: GB Trudeau.
128.series: Aug. 18, 1988) "This is My Dad's 25-Year-Old Golf Cart"*
notes: Summary: George Bush's son is introducing him using a slide show.

129.title: Golf
129.author: Young & Drake.
129.series: Aug. 20, 1988) "It's Because He Didn't Count One Hole"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood brags that he knocked eight strokes off his average; Herb fills in the details.

130.title: Golf
130.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Thirsty and Hi try to make a golf date.

131.title: Golf
131.author: by Jeff Millar & Bill Hinds
131.appears_in: reproduced on p. 135 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Dad explains the golf term, as the family car is towed up by a wrecker.

132.title: Golf
132.author: Young & Drake.
132.series: Sept. 10, 1988) "I Lost Four Balls and I Found Seven!"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood had a good day at golf.

133.title: Golf
133.author: Graham.
133.series: Sept. 10, 1988) "I'm Sitting on What Used to be a Rockery"*
notes: Summary: Fred deplores the state of their garden, while his master leaves for golf.

134.title: Golf
134.author: Graham.
134.series: Sept. 18, 1988) "I Hope We're Not Going to Have Another Day Like Yesterday"*
notes: Summary: Fred's master takes his first swing at the golf ball, gets as much dirt as ball, and his face turns red.

135.title: Golf
135.author: by Johnny Hart.
notes: Summary: A golf ball is heading for someone's noggin.

136.title: Golf
136.author: by Johnny Hart.
136.series: Sept. 22, 1988) "There's Nothing in the Rule Book Against Putting Like This"*

137.title: Golf
137.author: by Johnny Hart.
137.series: Sept. 23, 1988) "I Am the Swamp Fairy. Throw in 5 Clams and I'll Toss Your Ball Out"*
notes: Summary: The golfers have lost a ball in the tall grass.

138.title: Golf
138.author: Graham.
138.series: Oct. 15, 1988) "The Usual Saturday Morning Friendly Foursome"*
notes: Summary: An argument is in progress about whether the ball is in a rabbit scrape or a divot mark.

139.title: Golf
139.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: Plushbottom practices some chip shots at home, and hits into the kids' sandbox.

140.title: Golf
140.author: by Schulz.
notes: Summary: Everybody blames lawyers, who in turn blame doctors, but who does the doctor blame?

141.title: Golf
141.author: Frank Johnson.
141.series: Nov. 26, 1988) "I Can't Guess What You're Supposed to Be, Snooky!"*
notes: Summary: Snook the snake is impersonating a golf club.

142.title: Golf
142.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: Lord P. is teed off, lost his third ball, and to his surprise the sneaky thing is right by the green.

143.title: Golf
143.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: Geese fly south and Plushie sadly puts his clubs away for the winter.

144.title: Golf
144.author: Saunders, Ziegler, Armstrong.
144.series: Dec. 8, 1988) "He Doesn't Golf! and he Hates Parties!"*
notes: Summary: Grant Inwood is friendless because he has nothing in common with this neighbors.

145.title: Golf
145.author: Jim Berry.
notes: Summary: A caution sign shows a swinging golfer, and a flying ball is heading for a man's head.

146.title: Golf
146.author: Hart.
146.series: Dec. 23, 1988) "I See You're Still Playing Your Slice"*
notes: Summary: Hit by the axe, the Christmas tree flies off to the right.

147.title: Golf
147.author: Mort Walker.
147.series: Dec. 30, 1988) "I'm Leaving to Meet the General Now"*
notes: Summary: The chaplain says a prayer before playing golf.

148.title: Golf
148.author: by Bill Rechin and Don Wilder
148.appears_in: dated 1989 and reproduced on p. 150 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The hazard is a canteen being emptied in the desert between the tee and the green.

149.title: Golf
149.author: Mort Walker.
149.series: Jan. 5, 1989) "I Hate Playing Golf in the Mountains"*
notes: Summary: General Halftrack yells 'fore,' and the echo seems to come from all directions.

150.title: Golf
150.author: Russell Myers.
150.series: Jan. 6, 1989) "Why Do You 'Spose She Was So Insistent We Fasten Our Seat Belts?"*
notes: Summary: The conquered aliens want reparations, and Broom-Hilda prepares to send them back to Xorf with her golf club.

151.title: Golf
151.author: Schulz.
151.series: Feb. 4, 1989) "A Three-Wood, a Four-Iron, and a Rake!"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown wonders what it'll take to get out of the trap and onto the green.

152.title: Golf
152.author: Jim Berry.
152.series: Feb. 15, 1989) "Dan, I'm Happy to Hear What You've Been Doing Lately, but not Hole-by-Hole!"
notes: Summary: George Bush is talking to Dan Quayle.

153.title: Golf
153.author: by John Saunders, Bill Ziegler and Jim Armstrong.
153.series: Feb. 24, 1989) "I Believe Professional Golfers Should Eat in the Kitchen and Sleep in the Car!"*

154.title: Golf
154.author: Saunders-Ziegler ; Armstrong.
154.series: Mar. 1, 1989) "I Went to College on a Golf Scholarship!"*
notes: Summary: Doug Cory recites his qualifications.

155.title: Golf
155.author: Bill Holbrook
155.series: Apr. 12, 1989) "How Many Strokes Do I Lose if the Ball Dissolves?"*
155.appears_in: reproduced on p. 155 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Ms. Trellis doesn't want to discuss acid rain, until her golf ball lands in the water and starts to fizz.

156.title: Golf
156.author: Mort Walker.
156.series: Apr. 12, 1989) "Look At Him Sitting There Thinking About His Golf Game"*
notes: Summary: The general thinks people think he's thinking about military problems.

157.title: Golf
157.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: Plushbottom may have to give up golf because his clubs are wrapped around trees.

158.title: Golf
158.author: Young & Drake.
158.series: May 6, 1989) "That's Why I Hired You in the First Place"*
notes: Summary: The golf pro asks Dagwood if he can take a full swing at the ball, but not actually hit it.

159.title: Golf
159.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: The Professor uses a flattened ball for water holes.

160.title: Golf
160.author: MacNelly.
160.series: May 12, 1989) "It Could Be Worse, I Guess"*
notes: Summary: The Professor's golf ball has landed on a fishing boat in the lake, and he's playing it from there.

161.title: Golf
161.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: The boss at Foofram Industries wants to know how many people called in sick.

162.title: Golf
162.author: Mort Walker.
162.series: May 27, 1989) "That's the 150th Time You've Said, 'Great Shot, Sir'"*
notes: Summary: The General is beginning to think Lt. Fuzz is buttering him up.

163.title: Golf
163.author: Mort Walker.
163.series: June 14, 1989) "What Did He Shoot on the Back Nine?"*
notes: Summary: The General brags about his golf score, but he's only telling half the story.

164.title: Golf
164.author: by Johnny Hart
164.series: June 15, 1989) "You Won't Play Golf Alone Because There Will Be No One to Verify Your Hole-In-One"*
164.appears_in: reproduced on p. 168 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: A definition of optimism.

165.title: Golf
165.author: Hart.
notes: Summary: Golfers swap jargon.

166.title: Golf
166.author: Mort Walker.
166.series: June 24, 1989) "This Looks Likes a Good Spot"*
notes: Summary: General Halftrack is looking on the golf course for a more convenient office location.

167.title: Golf
167.author: by Bill Holbrook
167.series: July 12, 1989) "No Problem. I Moved My Gall Bladder to 4:30"*
167.appears_in: reproduced on p. 159 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Mom is alarmed to learn that Dave and Samantha are playing doctor, and relieved that that means a round of golf.

168.title: Golf
168.author: by Larry Wright.
168.series: July 29, 1989) "You'll Probably Never Play That Poorly Again.. Now can we go Home?"*
notes: Summary: She explains about beginner's luck, but she's beaten him at golf.

169.title: Golf
169.author: Larry Wright.
notes: Summary: Carlyle's hitting bits of cat food with a golf club.

170.title: Golf
170.author: Al Scaduto.
170.series: Aug. 9, 1989) "Dimbulb Sells his Missus on Taking Up Golf"

171.title: Golf
171.author: by J
171.series: Aug. 11, 1989) "Lance Would Laugh Whenever He Recalled His Empty Existence Before Golf"
171.appears_in: C. Duffy. reproduced on p. 163 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).

172.title: Golf
172.author: Dik Browne.
172.series: Aug. 23, 1989) "And This is Just the Fairway"*
notes: Summary: Hagar and Eddie have never seen so much underbrush and so many rocks on a golf course.

173.title: Golf
173.author: Jim Berry.
173.series: Aug. 30, 1989) "I've Come Up with a Program for the Homeless- Teaching Them How to Play Golf"*
notes: Summary: Dan Quayle is talking to George Bush.

174.title: Golf
174.author: Hart.
174.series: Sept. 5, 1989) "The First Harbinger of Metal Woods"*
notes: Summary: The ball makes metallic sounds as it bounces off trees.

175.title: Golf
175.author: Hart.
notes: The ground falls away from the edges of the green like a mesa.

176.title: Golf
176.author: Jim Berry.
176.series: Sept. 7, 1989) "When Can I Go On a Vacation? I Think I'm Over-Golfed!"
notes: Summary: Dan Quayle is talking to George Bush.

177.title: Golf
177.author: Hart.
notes: Wordless strip, with a golf ball on a tee and Grog holding a golf bag.

178.title: Golf
178.author: Dik Browne.
178.series: Sept. 11, 1989) "Let Me Try My No. 3 Sword"*
notes: Summary: Hagar's back from Scotland, and has all his weapons in a golf bag.

179.title: Golf
179.author: Moore.
179.series: Sept. 12, 1989) "Crud! Wouldn't You Know It! Right into a Land Hazard"
notes: Summary: Underwater creatures are golfing.

180.title: Golf
180.author: Hart.
180.series: Sept. 12, 1989) "I Was In the Trap All Day"*
notes: Summary: He describes his golf game by showing a steel trap on his ankle.

181.title: Golf
181.author: by Steve Moore.
notes: Summary: The helicopter reports on an overturned cart, a slow foursome, and a putter-bender.

182.title: Golf
182.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: A 'perfect grandparent' is somebody who's made a hole in one.

183.title: Golf
183.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Thirsty's thinking about new clubs, and Hi recommends flexible shafts.

184.title: Golf
184.author: Yates-Casson.
184.series: Oct. 7, 1989) "My Foursome Will Kill Me if I'm Late for Tee Off!"*
notes: Summary: The doctor wishes Redeye hadn't waited so long with his problem.

185.title: Golf
185.author: Guisewite.
185.series: Oct. 12, 1989) "A Crisis Involving One of Your Golf Buddies?"*
notes: Summary: Cathy figures out why Mr. Pinkley's new crisis is more important than the crisis she's already working on.

186.title: Golf
186.author: Mort Walker.
186.series: Oct. 20, 1989) "It's Your Turn to Ask Him What He Got On This Hole"*
notes: Summary: General Halftrack is not hitting the ball well.

187.title: Golf
187.author: Dik Browne.
187.series: Oct. 31, 1989) "That's Jerry the Golf Pro and his Son Tommy"*
notes: Summary: Hi knows who the trick-or-treaters in the golf cart were.

188.title: Golf
188.author: Yates-Casson.
188.series: Nov. 10, 1989) "He Just Left on a Life-and-Death Emergency Call"*
notes: Summary: The nurse (her desk sign says 'Deceptionist') says the doctor's not in; we see him dashing out the back with his golf clubs.

189.title: Golf
189.author: Mike Peters
189.appears_in: reproduced on p. 147 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Watching out for the dogleg.

190.title: Golf
190.author: Browne.
190.series: Nov. 14, 1989) "Waiting Rooms, Collection Agencies, and Golf"*
notes: Summary: Dr. Zook talks about recent medical breakthroughs.

191.title: Golf
191.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy hits a powerful drive; Charlie Brown is his caddie.

192.title: Golf
192.author: Ferd & Tom Johnson.
notes: Summary: Plushbottom's golf game went well.
